meta.name: description
meta.content: This is the website for the Mazon-Verona-Kinsman Elementary District 2C.

body.class: site com_content view-featured no-layout no-task itemid-435 fluid

h2.a: Updates For The Morning Of April 21st

p.span: E-Learning lessons for this week have been posted. Mouse over the "Students" menu item, then mouse over "E-Learning Lessons", then mouse over your grade level, and finally click on the Apr 21 - Apr 24 link for that grade level. There are four days of lessons for this week and they are due the end of the day on Friday April 24th.

Students with paper copies should drop them off at the Middle School between 1pm and 6pm on Fridy April 24th. As they drop off this week's lessons students will be given the next week's lessons. Please keep in mind, there are still some P.E. clothes, third quarter report cards, and registration packets for next school year which need to be picked up at the Middle School. If you need different hours for drop-off/pickup because of work schedules, please contact the District Office at 815-448-2200.
Thanks again for your cooperation and hard your hard work.
Mr. Rowe

h2.a: Updates For The Morning Of April 14th

p.span: E-Learning lessons for this week have been posted. Mouse over the "Students" menu item, then mouse over "E-Learning Lessons", then mouse over your grade level, and finally click on the Apr 14 - Apr 17 link for that grade level. There are four days of lessons for this week and they are due the end of the day on Friday April 17th.

Students with paper copies should drop them off at the Middle School between 1pm and 6pm on Fridy April 17th. As they drop off this week's lessons students will be given the next week's lessons. Please keep in mind, there are still some P.E. clothes, third quarter report cards, and registration packets for next school year which need to be picked up at the Middle School. If you need different hours for drop-off/pickup because of work schedules, please contact the District Office at 815-448-2200.
Thanks again for your cooperation and hard your hard work.
Mr. Rowe

h2.a: Updates For The Morning of April 7th

p.span: E-Learning lessons for this week have been posted. Mouse over the "Students" menu item, then mouse over "E-Learning Lessons", then mouse over your grade level, and finally click on the Apr 7 - Apr13 link for that grade level. There are only three days of lessons this week and they are due by the end of the day on Thursday April 9th. Students with paper copies should drop them off at the Middle School between 1pm and 6pm on Thursday April 9th. As they drop off this week's lessons students will be given the next week's lessons.
Thanks again for your cooperation and hard your hard work.
Mr. Rowe

h2.a: Updates For The Morning of April 6th

div.p: E-learning assignments are due by the end of the day today. Students using paper copies will see them picked up some time this afternoon and will be given the next three assignments. This is the last time assignments will be picked up and deliverd by school personel. All assignments, both electonic and paper, are due Thursday April 9th by the end of the day.

Paper copies of assignments should be dropped off at the school on Thursday April 9th between 1pm and 6pm at the Middle School. As you drop off the Apr 7th-9th assignments you will be given the next week's (Apr 14th - 17th) assignments. These assignments will be due the end of the day on April 17th with drop off of old and pick-up of new occuring between 1pm and 6pm at the Middle School on April 17th.
The current plan is to continue this type of exchange for the forseeable future.
Thank you for all your hard work and cooperation.

h2.a: Update for the Afternoon of April 2nd.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'courier new', courier; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Good Afternoon,

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'courier new', courier; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: I hope everyone is doing well and staying healthy. As we navigate our way through E-Learning, I wanted to clarify a few things and make you aware of a couple changes. The 3 lessons posted on the website are due at the end of the day on Monday, April 6. Students who completed the paper packet need to have the first 3 days ready for pick up by Monday, April 6 at 1 pm. The new packet will be delivered at that time. This will be the last delivery for paper packets. Packets for future weeks will need to be dropped off and picked up according to the schedule outlined below.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'courier new', courier; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Starting Tuesday, April 7, there will only be one Art and one Music assignment to complete throughout the week. There will also only be two Computer assignments to complete throughout the week.

p.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 16px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: 'courier new', courier;

p.span: There will be no new assignments posted on April 13, April 20, and April 27. We will be using these days as Remote Learning Planning Days. Students will be able to utilize these days to get caught up on any missing assignments.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'courier new', courier; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Students who receive a paper copy of the assignments will need to drop off the packet for April 7-9 to the Middle School from 1 pm - 6 pm on Thursday, April 9. You will also be able to pick up a paper copy for April 14-17 at this time. On Friday, April 17 you will be able to drop off and pick up the work for April 20-24 at the Middle School from 1 pm - 6 pm. On April 24 you will be able to drop off and pick up the work for April 27-30 at the Middle School from 1 pm - 6 pm. The work for April 27-30 can be turned in when we return to school on Friday, May 1st.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Thank you for your patience and flexibility as we make adjustments as needed to best meet the needs of our students. If you have any questions feel free to contact me at
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'courier new', courier; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Thank You,

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'courier new', courier; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Mr. DiNello

h2.a: Updates for the Morning of April 1st

p.span: The "e-Learning Lessons" link found under the menu item "Students" has become active. Students should hover their mouse arrow over the "Students" menu item, then hover over "E-Learning Lessons", then hover over their grade level, and then click on the date range to open a folder with their lessons. The first three lessons for Tuesday March 31st - Monday April 6th are posted and ready to go.

Teachers will be monitoring their e-mail from 9am to 3pm each day and will answer questions as soon as they can. Please email them with any questions about the assignments. All of the teachers' email addresses can be found under the "Students" menu item by clicking on the "MVK Staff" link.

Before starting any lessons, I would advise all 5th - 8th grade students to first login to their MVK email accounts to check for messages from their teachers and to have access to their Google Drive and Google Classrooms.
Mr. Rowe

h2.a: Updates From the Afternoon of March 27th

p.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Good afternoon.

p.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Beginning Monday, March 30, breakfasts and lunches will be delivered twice a week. On Mondays, we will deliver two days of meals and on Wednesdays, we will deliver 3 days of meals.

p.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: We will be using the buses now, so you will need to be watching for your delivery. We will be leaving the school around 10:00 am. Please be ready for us. We will continue this schedule for the remainder of the school closure.

p.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Thanks,

p.style: color: #500050; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Mrs. Dillow

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Good afternoon.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: I hope this message finds you well. E-Learning Days will begin on Tuesday, March 31. Students will be able to find their assignments online using the directions previously sent. Make sure to log in and do your work daily, making a schedule can help you keep on track. Students with packets that were sent home on Friday, March 13, should begin working on them. Please keep all of your work together. We will be delivering a second packet to those students on Monday, April 6. We will pick up the first packet of materials on that day.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Please remember that you can email teachers if you have and questions.

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: I can't wait to see everyone soon!!!

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
p.span: Mrs. Dillow

h2.a: Update From the Afternoon of March 15th

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 10px;
